# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/darwin-arm64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_vendor/idna/compat.py
@source-hash: d3fb0e114313e025
@generated: 2026-02-09T17:58:44Z

## Purpose
Compatibility layer for IDNA (Internationalized Domain Names in Applications) providing legacy API functions that wrap the core IDNA 2008 implementation.

## Key Functions
- **ToASCII** (L5-6): Converts Unicode domain label to ASCII-compatible encoding (ACE) format by delegating to `encode()` from core module
- **ToUnicode** (L8-9): Converts ASCII-compatible encoded bytes/bytearray back to Unicode string by delegating to `decode()` from core module  
- **nameprep** (L11-12): Legacy function that raises NotImplementedError since IDNA 2008 specification doesn't use the nameprep protocol (unlike IDNA 2003)

## Dependencies
- Imports all symbols from `.core` and `.codec` modules (L1-2)
- Uses `typing.Any` and `typing.Union` for type annotations (L3)

## Architecture Notes
This is a thin compatibility shim maintaining backward compatibility with older IDNA APIs while the actual implementation lives in the core/codec modules. The naming convention (PascalCase) suggests compatibility with older or external APIs that expect this specific interface.

## Type Signatures
- `ToASCII`: `str -> bytes`
- `ToUnicode`: `Union[bytes, bytearray] -> str` 
- `nameprep`: `Any -> None` (always raises exception)
